page.title: 07 COMMUNICATION
page.content: Within the area, public Services really are poor. There art only two telephone boxes for general use and there is therefore a dependence upon personal telephones. Harley is served by a daily bus service connecting Much Wenlock and Shrewsbury. There are no railways in the area, the nearest station being Shrewsbury, a fair distance away. Milk is not delivered until 2.00 p.m.. The roads are all old ones and are narrow with room for only one way traffic except in the villages. Except in village areas, road surfaces are poor but this is a feature generally associated with Shropshire at this time. It is a quiet area with just a few lorries serving farms. Peaple have to be self sufficient with private cars and telephones.
